name: Elixabeth

features.name: Elixabeth Orbital Station
features.description: Class B orbital starport. Spacecraft construction, overhaul, refined fuel. Imperial Naval Base attached. The station gleams against the darkness — military precision in vacuum.
features.campaignNotes: PCs departed from here Jan 20. Vasquez gave mission briefing. Cold Comfort bar is in Port Town below.

features.name: Port Town
features.culture: Support services for naval base. Transient population. Cold Comfort bar.
features.description: Surface settlement below the orbital station. Domes and sealed buildings. Support services, civilian commerce, the Cold Comfort bar where Gristle sells information.
features.campaignNotes: Gristle operates here. Harlan's apartment is in Port Town — bugged by pirates.

features.name: Freedome Settlement
features.culture: Forinean dissident descendants. Anti-authoritarian, proud of independence won in 975.
features.description: Original colony founded by Forinean political and religious dissidents. The Closed-Fist Greeting is used proudly here. Scratch-art visible on dome walls — same tradition as Milagro but with defiant rather than bitter tone.
features.campaignNotes: Cultural echo — PCs who visited may have already seen cultural items without recognizing their significance.

features.name: Elixabeth Naval Base
features.description: Primary Imperial Navy facility for the Collace Arm approach. Houses patrol squadrons, intelligence operations, and supply infrastructure. Lt. Kowal operates from here.
features.campaignNotes: Naval Leak thread originates here. Kowal feeds patrol routes to pirates. Vasquez is unaware.

regions.name: Polar Ice Fields
regions.description: Extensive polar ice covering northern and southern latitudes. Chemical ice with sulfur taint compounds. Wilderness refueling possible by mining and processing ice.

regions.name: Tainted Lowlands
regions.description: Low-lying regions with concentrated atmospheric taint. Filter masks required. Sparse dome-agriculture and mining operations.

arrivalBriefing:
Elixabeth appears on sensors as a small, pale world scarred by ice fields, orbiting twin red dwarfs that cast everything in ruddy light. The Class B orbital station is the first thing you see — a bright structure against the dark, bristling with docking arms and the silhouettes of naval vessels.

Below, the surface is frozen and wind-scoured, dotted with sealed settlements connected by surface transit tubes. The atmospheric taint is invisible but ever-present — filter masks are mandatory outside sealed structures.

gmQuickRef.population: 20K total. Naval base 8K, Port Town 7K, Freedome 5K.
gmQuickRef.hazards: Very thin tainted atmosphere. Filter masks required. Low gravity (0.37G). Cold.
gmQuickRef.firstImpressions: Military precision at the station, frontier resilience below. Everyone seems to be watching.
